questions.text: False statement regarding Zanker’s diverticulum is:

options.label: A
options.text: It is a type of traction diverticulum.

options.label: B
options.text: It arises from the posterior hypopharynx.

options.label: C
options.text: The diagnostic test is Ba. Swallow.

options.label: D
options.text: Usual surgical treatment is diverticulectomy with cricopharyngeal myotomy.

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a type of traction diverticulum.

questions.text: A Patient of Tracheo-esophageal fistula with low birth weight and significant pneumonia is best treated by?

options.label: A
options.text: Urgent initial tracheostomy to prevent aspiration then definitive curative thoracotomy.

options.label: B
options.text: Initial Total Parenteral nutrition then curative thoracotomy.

options.label: C
options.text: Initial feeding gastrostomy and treatment of pneumonia then definitive thoracotomy.

questions.correct_answer: C. Initial feeding gastrostomy and treatment of pneumonia then definitive thoracotomy.

questions.text: A 50 year old male after heavy meal went for walk. He developed severe chest pain associated with vomiting. He was brought to Emergency room and CT scan revealed pneumomediastinum. Most probable diagnosis in this patient is?
False statement about Mellory Weiss syndrome is?

options.label: A
options.text: Mainly caused by vomiting or retching.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a submucosa deep tear.

options.label: C
options.text: Epigastric pain is the main presenting symptom.

questions.correct_answer: C. Epigastric pain is the main presenting symptom.

questions.text: False statement about highly selective vagotomy is?

options.label: A
options.text: First done by Amdrup and Johnston.

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior and posterior vagus nerves are preserved but its branched are devided.

options.label: C
options.text: The recurrence rate is less than truncal vagotomy.

options.label: D
options.text: Higher incidence of cancer observed after truncal vagotomy is not seen after highly selective vagotomy.

questions.correct_answer: C. The recurrence rate is less than truncal vagotomy.

questions.text: False statement about congenital hypertrophic pyloric stenosis is?

A old male patient was being treated for antral gastric cancer by PPI for 12 weeks. Repeat upper GI series sowed 50% shrinkage in the size of the ulcer. What further management should be advised for the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue pharmacological therapy for 8-12 weeks the get a repeat upper GI series.

options.label: B
options.text: An upper GI endoscopy and multiple biopsy

questions.correct_answer: B. An upper GI endoscopy and multiple biopsy

questions.text: Which of the following type best defines early gastric cancer?

options.label: C
options.text: Gastric cancer in mucosa or submucosa with or without nodes.

options.label: D
options.text: Gastric cancer upto muscle but not involving nodes.

questions.correct_answer: C. Gastric cancer in mucosa or submucosa with or without nodes.

questions.text: Best treatment for a 5 cm cancer situated at the fundus of stomach with 2 positive nodes is?

options.label: C
options.text: Total Radical gastrectomy with Roux en Y esophagojejunostomy.

questions.correct_answer: C. Total Radical gastrectomy with Roux en Y esophagojejunostomy.

questions.text: Which is false for GIST (Gastro intestinal stromal tumor) of stomach?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the same as leiomyoma and leomyosarcoma as described previously.

options.label: B
options.text: Origin is from mucosa from the interstitial cells of Cajal

options.label: D
options.text: Imatinab is a new effective drug for adjuvant therapy

questions.correct_answer: B. Origin is from mucosa from the interstitial cells of Cajal

questions.text: Most common type of gastric volvulus is?
False statement about functional anatomy of Couinaud is?

options.label: A
options.text: Right liver is divided by anterior and posterior sectors.

options.label: B
options.text: Right and left liver are divided by falsiform ligament.

options.label: C
options.text: Segment IV is called quadrate lobe.

options.label: D
options.text: Segment 1 takes blood supply from both right and left hepatic artery.

questions.correct_answer: B. Right and left liver are divided by falsiform ligament.

questions.text: Which of the following is a false statement regarding amoebic liver abscess?

options.label: A
options.text: Main presenting symptom is pain associated with jaundice.

options.label: B
options.text: Right lobe abscess, situated on superior surface may cause pain in right shoulder.

options.label: C
options.text: Abscess at bare area of liver may be painless.

options.label: D
options.text: Abscess situated in the left lobe is an indication for drainage.

questions.correct_answer: A. Main presenting symptom is pain associated with jaundice.

questions.text: What is not true about Fibrolamellar carcinoma of the liver?

A 34 year old female patient presents in ER with spontaneous intaperitoneal hemorrhage. She is on regular OC Pills for last 5 years. USG revealed a 3 cm mass in right lobe of liver with hemoperitoneum. Most likely cause of hemorrhage is?

A patient recovering from trauma in ICU developed severe pain in right upper abdomen and fever. USG showed increased Gall bladder wall thickness and pericholecystic edema, but no stone in the gall bladder. On ward round senior resident observed gas shadow in the wall of gall bladder in X ray. Best treatment for this patient should be?

options.label: C
options.text: Nil orally/ IV fluids/ Broad spectrum antibiotics.

questions.text: On a routine USG of abdomen a 5 mm indolent single gall bladder polyp was found. What should be next line of treatment for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate open cholecystectomy. (Considering high chances of pericholecystic fibrosis and cancer, open approach should be preferred).

options.label: C
options.text: ERCP (To rule out possibility of sloughing of polyp and getting impacted in CBD).

options.label: D
options.text: Close observation and regular follow up.

questions.correct_answer: D. Close observation and regular follow up.

questions.text: In a post operative case of Lap Cholecystectomy patient acme after 4 weeks with features of cholengitis. ERCP/ MRCP showed about 40% narrowing in diameter of 2 cm length of CBD. Diagnosis of post operative benign CBD stricture was made. Best treatment for this patient should be?

options.label: A
options.text: Resection and end to end anastomosis over T tube

questions.text: In the classification of cholangiocarcinoma by site, Bismuth Type II is?

options.label: A
options.text: Confined to the common hepatic duct

options.label: B
options.text: Involve the bifurcation without involvement of secondary intrahepatic ducts

options.label: C
options.text: Tumors extend into either the right or left secondary intrahepatic ducts, respectively.

options.label: D
options.text: Involve the secondary intrahepatic ducts on both sides.

questions.correct_answer: B. Involve the bifurcation without involvement of secondary intrahepatic ducts

questions.text: Most common site for cholangiocarcinoma-
Which is not elevated in a child presenting with jaundice, icterus, pruritus & clay coloured stools-
Rigler’s triad is seen in?

A patient presenting with fever pain and jaundice with cholelithiasis and dilated CBD on ultrasound was being managed on conservative line. After 4 days no improvement was observed, now the next line of management should be?

options.label: B
options.text: MRCP followed by ERCP and decompression of CBD.

questions.correct_answer: B. MRCP followed by ERCP and decompression of CBD.

questions.text: An alcoholic patient is having repeated upper abdominal pain, malabsorption and DM. He was managed conservatively. Now he is not responding to conservative treatment. ERCP finding is chain of lake appearance. What surgical procedure can be done for this patient?
Which of the following does not correlate with severity of acute pancreatitis
Watery diarrhea, Hypokalemia, achlorhydrea and acidosis is seen in?
Multiple air fluid level is not seen in?
Which of the following is false regarding Hirschsprung’s disease?

options.label: A
options.text: It is characterized by a dilated proximal segment and a spastic distal segment joined together by a funnel shaped transition zone.

options.label: B
options.text: There is absence of intramural and submucosal ganglion.

options.label: C
options.text: There is absence of nerve in affected segment.

questions.correct_answer: C. There is absence of nerve in affected segment.

questions.text: A 17 yr old boy was treated by a GP for pain right iliac fossa by antibiotic and analgesic. His symptoms did not improve after 3 days and due to recurrent vomiting and persistence of pain he attended ER. On examination his PR was 102/ min, temp was 100.4 F and there was a palpable tender lump in RIF. USG revealed a mass of 3 × 4 cm in size and no fluid in pouch of douglus. No obvious evidence of abscess was there. Ideal treatment for this patient is?

options.label: C
options.text: Appendicectomy through exploratory laparotomy suspecting appendicular perforation.

questions.text: A 42 yr old lady with past history of hysterectomy 4 years back presents to the emergency department with abdominal pain and vomiting. On examination bowel sounds were increased and X ray showed multiple air fluid level. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 75 yrs old lady presented to ER with H/O chronic constipation, pain abdomen and obstipation for 1 day. Abdomen was grossly distended and tympanetic on percussion. X ray abdomen showed “Coffee bean sign”. There was no feature of peritonitis. Next step in management should be?
Treatment of Type III biliary atresia is?
Commonest presentation of Meckle’s diverticulum is?
Treatment of 3 cm carcinoid at base of appendix is?
Commonest type of intussusception is?
Nigro’s regimen of chemo-radiation is used for?
Ideal treatment for a low type of fistula in ano 2.5 cms from anal verge is?

options.label: B
options.text: Colostomy and second stage fistula surgery (as it is > 2 cm from anal verge)

questions.text: All are true regarding inguinal canal except

options.label: A
options.text: Roof is formed by conjoint tendon

options.label: B
options.text: Deep inguinal ring is formed by transverse abdominus muscle.

options.label: C
options.text: Superficial inguinal ring is formed by ext. obliq. Muscle

options.label: D
options.text: Int. oblique muscle forms anterior and post. wall

questions.correct_answer: B. Deep inguinal ring is formed by transverse abdominus muscle.

questions.text: Not a content of triangle of Doom?
questions.correct_answer: D. Femoral branch of genitofemoral nerve

questions.text: Bouvert syndrome is?

options.label: A
options.text: Fundus varicosities seen in portal hypertension.

options.label: B
options.text: An anteral web causing adult pyloric obstruction.

options.label: C
options.text: A type of dumping syndrome seen after Ramstedt operation.

options.label: D
options.text: Gastric outlet obstruction seen in gall stone obstruction.

questions.correct_answer: D. Gastric outlet obstruction seen in gall stone obstruction.
